intro: Guettarda calcicola, commonly known as the limestone guettarda, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its leaves are usually opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture. Guettarda calcicola is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate saline conditions.
